author: Odeinoichus
title: Arrrr! Avast, More Pirates be Here.
review:
Set #71013 Scallywag Pirate: Zombie Pirates, Pirate Captains and now a Scallywag Pirate, LEGO CMF really like to bring back Pirates in some fashion or form every so often.

The Scallywag Pirate features dual-molded legs with some nice white stripes printed over dark green leggings, or short pants, or whatever you'd care to call them. His torso is dual-sided with the print, showing a bare chest covered by a ratty tattered looking blue vest and a brown belt to hold up his pants. An anchor tatoo is on the side of his arm. He's got the traditional looking eyepatch with scraggly beard on his face and features a brand new balte pate scalp piece with a red bandana tied around it.

For accessories he's got the ordinary looking Pirates sword and a treasure map which features a more recent print, possibly even brand new for this figure, it's so hard to tell when you've seen so many different map prints over the years. Overall, while I love the detailing I'd have to mildly recommend this one, Pirates just aren't everybody's cup of tea sadly and despite trying unique and different looks the CMF Pirates tend to get a little repetitive or uninspired. Next time can we get a brand new red coat or blue coat? It'd be nice to see the heroes of LEGO Pirates show up in the CMF line.

author: Balistarius
title: Map!
review: A nice figure, but with an amusing detail overlooked by most: If the map piece is turned correctly, it shows Copenhagen, the capital of Denmark and the surrounding area. The X on the map is a suburban area west of the city - I wonder what treasure is buried there?
